text: Bildad’s Second Speech
Then\f + \fr 18:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,
“⸤How long⸥\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* ⸤will you\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Plural \f* hunt for words⸥?\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Literally “will you set a snare for words” \f*
Consider,\f + \fr 18:2 \ft Or “you should consider”; plural second person \f* and afterward we shall speak.
Why are we considered as animals?
\add Why\add* are we taken as\f + \fr 18:3 \ft Or “considered” \f* stupid in your\f + \fr 18:3 \ft Plural \f* eyes?
“\add You who\add* are tearing ⸤yourself⸥\f + \fr 18:4 \ft Literally “his soul,” or “his individual self” \f* in your\f + \fr 18:4 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* anger,
will \add the\add* earth be forsaken because of you?\f + \fr 18:4 \ft Singular \f*
Or\f + \fr 18:4 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* will \add the\add* rock be removed from its place?
Furthermore,\f + \fr 18:5 \ft Or “Also” \f* the light of \add the\add* wicked is put out,
and the flame of his fire will not shine.
The light becomes dark in his tent,
and his lamp above him is put out.
“⸤His strong steps⸥\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Literally “The steps of his power” \f* are shortened,
and his \add own\add* schemes\f + \fr 18:7 \ft Collective singular \f* throw him down,
for he is thrust into a net by his feet,
and he walks into a pitfall.
A trap seizes \add him\add* by \add the\add* heel;
a snare takes hold of him.
His rope is hidden in the ground,
and his trap on \add the\add* path.
“Sudden terrors terrify him all around,
and they chase him at his heels.
His wealth will become hunger,
and disaster is ready for his stumbling.
It consumes parts of his skin;
the firstborn of death consumes his limbs.
He is torn from his tent ⸤in which he trusted⸥,\f + \fr 18:14 \ft Literally “his trust” \f*
and it brought him to the king of terrors.
“⸤Nothing⸥\f + \fr 18:15 \ft Literally “From not” \f* remains for him in his tent;
sulfur is scattered upon his dwelling place.
His roots dry up ⸤below⸥,\f + \fr 18:16 \ft Literally “from under” \f*
and its branches\f + \fr 18:16 \ft Singular collective \f* wither away above.\f + \fr 18:16 \ft Hebrew “from above” \f*
His remembrance perishes from \add the\add* earth,
and \add there is\add* not a name for him on \add the\add* street.
“They thrust him from light into darkness,
and they drive him out from \add the\add* world.
\add There is\add* no offspring for him nor\f + \fr 18:19 \ft Hebrew “and not” \f* a descendant among his people,
and there is not a survivor in his abode.
\add Those of the\add* west are appalled over ⸤his fate⸥,\f + \fr 18:20 \ft Literally “his day” \f*
and \add those of the\add* east ⸤are seized with horror⸥.\f + \fr 18:20 \ft Literally “they seize horror” \f*
Surely these \add are\add* the dwellings of \add the\add* godless,
and this \add is\add* the dwelling place of him \add who\add* knows not God.”
